subject: Trivial: Remove --project-domain doc in "network create"
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-10 16:11:48.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/command-objects/network.rst'], 'message': 'Trivial: Remove --project-domain doc in "network create"

--project-domain option is not implemented for "network create" command
because openstack-sdk does not support it currently. So remove the doc
for now, and add it when the option is implemented.

Change-Id: I78ee9e32698ef477c6fc9c9865448b3592f6e9ad
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Trivial: Remove --project-domain doc in "network create"

--project-domain option is not implemented for "network create" command
because openstack-sdk does not support it currently. So remove the doc
for now, and add it when the option is implemented.

Change-Id: I78ee9e32698ef477c6fc9c9865448b3592f6e9ad

commit_message:
Factor _rebuild_pick_host out of rebuild_instance

rebuild_instance is a bit big, pull the pick host logic out for
readability.

Blueprint check-destination-on-migrations

Planning Guide 6.1 incorrectly suggest that Mirantis
support Swift for object store backend

Closes-Bug: #1524667

commit_message:
Added constraints tox targets

These are eventually going to be used in gate instead of unconstrained
jobs. There is some code duplication in commands definitions, but tox
does not allow to inherit definitions with {posargs} substitution.

Made tox_install.sh use constraints file to install both the project and
neutron dependency, if the first argument is 'constrained'.

Note: To test the docs targets, needed to fix a formatting issue in
multiple-local-subnets.rst document.

Change-Id: I699022b285594edf3c5db10fbdac2f904dc42928
Partial-Bug: #1522503
Depends-On: Icfc50a0a9330dbc2a59f9bb27f09944bdf0e00d1

commit_message:
devstack: Update after the recent fwaas change

The recent neutron-fwaas change [1] made the configuration file
auto-generated during a devstack run.  Unfortunately, we override
neutron_fwaas_configure_driver function, in which the file is
generated.  This change applies the relevant devstack change [2]
to our variant of the function.

[1] I31be3295606ba25929e9af9f40a035ff2b615234
[2] Ic8208850a27408c8fbeed80ecdb43345aa7dfaa4

Closes-Bug: #1524657
Change-Id: I9fb83881a355b907eb4235c432e7666617bf9a7a

commit_message:
Allow heat on a dedicated node in a HA setup

Without this the haproxy role doesn't have the facts it needs to
render it's template, resulting in the following error:

TASK: [haproxy | Copying over config(s)]
************************************** fatal: [control01] => {'msg':
"AnsibleUndefinedVariable: One or more undefined variables: 'dict
object' has no attribute u'ansible_eno1'", 'failed': True}

This is similar to the fix applied previously for other services in
I99b7dbebd5a6193e192ee258ddf576d18db90ed7.

Change-Id: I279374e8861c02e3aa12988b885be7361e0cf2f5
Closes-Bug: 1524739

tox_install: Fix "already installed" test

For many of projects, the name of projects are slightly different from
the name of modules.  eg. neutron_fwaas vs neutron-fwaas.

commit_message:
VNX: Fix metadata get overriden issue

Cinder is using 'metadata' or 'volume_metadata' to return
volume metadata since versionedobjects is not fully merged,
so VNX could not get the correct existing
metadata, only append VNX specific metadata so existing
metadata get overridden.
In this fix, VNX will first try 'volume_metadata' if not exists,
try 'metadata' when getting metadata.

Change-Id: I1215883a6076e9b15b1ced19aa40aae43c66a00c
Closes-bug: 1516903

commit_message:
Pass FQDN to host_evacuate.sh command

FQDN is required for nova to identify the host since version 6.1.

Pass FQDN value from node's data hash to command host_evacuate.sh
if version of the original environment is 6.1 or higher. Pass
the short name (node-N) of the node otherwise.

Closes-bug: 1523469
Change-Id: I5be715f4eab445f3cf823526a98a23e7a1749f2a

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-10 11:30:43.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/heat/heat.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/heat/heat_spec.rb'], 'message': "Install heat-docker package only after heat-engine

Heat-engine package is heat-docker dependency,
so if installation of heat-docker package is performed before
heat-engine installation it leads to autostart of heat-engine package
(in that moment override file isn't exist yet, because it will be
triggered directly before evaluation of heat-engine package resource).
As a result, the heat-engine service is run without any configuration.

To fix that we need to sеt heat-engine package installation strictly
before heat-docker package.

Change-Id: I5420e64e3ab6b2ca0305f5f41eb722e3ead42b25
Closes-bug: #1520610
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Install heat-docker package only after heat-engine

Heat-engine package is heat-docker dependency,
so if installation of heat-docker package is performed before
heat-engine installation it leads to autostart of heat-engine package
(in that moment override file isn't exist yet, because it will be
triggered directly before evaluation of heat-engine package resource).
As a result, the heat-engine service is run without any configuration.

To fix that we need to sеt heat-engine package installation strictly
before heat-docker package.

Change-Id: I5420e64e3ab6b2ca0305f5f41eb722e3ead42b25
Closes-bug: #1520610

revisions:

When copying this documentation over from keystoneclient we much have
simply replaced occurences of keystoneclient with keystoneauth. Details
how to migrate keystoneclient to using sessions make sense in
keystoneclient however the migration doc makes no sense in keystoneauth1
because those parameters don't exist.

Change-Id: I70160f42115d7dfe7610699479baf2e9420fe1b3
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove confusing documentation

When copying this documentation over from keystoneclient we much have
simply replaced occurences of keystoneclient with keystoneauth. Details
how to migrate keystoneclient to using sessions make sense in
keystoneclient however the migration doc makes no sense in keystoneauth1
because those parameters don't exist.

Change-Id: I70160f42115d7dfe7610699479baf2e9420fe1b3

commit_message:
Fix queue create failure when metadata is {}

When user pass in {} as the PUT body, below code will take {} as
the flavor name. It's not correct.

flavor = metadata and metadata.get('_flavor', None)

This patch fixes it and add an unit test case for that.

Closes-Bug: #1518060

Depends-On: Ibd1f72ad95515cbfbaef217677c7230662552661
Change-Id: I20b69c99c4e8a44c752006024bc56f5b4cc2336a

from 1.7MB to 377KB.

commit_message:

This change takes advantage of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/241626
but can merge before that, the new parms are simply ignored if this
lands prior to that.

commit_message:
Forbid caching / for fuel-web

New header 'expires -1' forbids caching of / (index.html)
to avoid caching issues which may exist after master node
upgrade. This header is not needed for /static - for JS and
other assets Fuel UI uses its own cachebusting mechanism.

Change-Id: Ic9a199394a0167a4da977b5d135caf676e7d2b67
Closes-Bug: #1475310

commit_message:
Set tunnel timeout for nova_novncproxy

When using websockets in HAProxy, like nova_novncproxy does, we
need to set "timeout tunnel" to avoid disconnections after a short
period without traffic.

Change-Id: I1b66cd9a1d20cbbe35a2ada5782a76a01b14bcd1
Closes-BZ: 1267043

commit_message:
API 'manage' can set share attr 'is_public'

This fix allows manila-manage command to explicitly
set visibility (key '--public') similar to using API
"create".
Depends-On: I8725719b8c7ff5557fa20ebbb5314f3e770ffcc0

Change-Id: I4e9be0a9c2168ab6c89a0d0e1c281e4a05a05c6b
Closes-Bug: #1436865

commit_message:
Override $::os_package_type

MOS Ubuntu image uses Debian style packages. Since the introduction
of `$::os_package_type' fact avilable to use in project manifests,
we need to provide a manual override for Fuel Ubuntu images.

This commit updates the preseed template of Precise and Trusty.

Change-Id: Ic3c548d2abd972a071fc910fea2b425908906de5
Closes-Bug: #1517513

subject: Fix a warning with the params class
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-10 01:41:51.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "Fix a warning with the params class

You cannot use a param in the class arguments because it's evaluated
before the include. This fixes that issue.

Warning: Scope(Class[Cinder]): Could not look up qualified variable
'::cinder::params::lock_path'; class ::cinder::params has not been
evaluated

Change-Id: I703ac2ab0024a6f0095bf50406ab5bb4b8318224
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix a warning with the params class

You cannot use a param in the class arguments because it's evaluated
before the include. This fixes that issue.

Warning: Scope(Class[Cinder]): Could not look up qualified variable
'::cinder::params::lock_path'; class ::cinder::params has not been
evaluated

Change-Id: I703ac2ab0024a6f0095bf50406ab5bb4b8318224

Publish networking guide versioned

Publish networking guide as draft, so that we can version it.

Update introduction to mention that guide targets Mitaka release.

commit_message:
Makes microversions config option clear about 'None'

If StrOpt option is explicitly set as None, oslo config
will return it as string "None" which should be invalid
configuration.
Example-
   min_microversion = None will be end up with 'None'.

This commit makes that clear in config and raise exception
for the same.

Partially implements blueprint api-microversions-testing-support

Change-Id: I81e86faca6f8c0ffb7da22154a62236ac25cf0c0

commit_message:
Replace ceilometer with correct project name

Currently when setting up a new project, the cookiecutter
sets the logging spec to expect ceilometer configs, which
results in errors if not changed. This patch will replace
'ceilometer' with the correct name to avoid this.

Change-Id: I05d38cc87f25c8161b8f4ee43fb5ba72cea49ca6

commit_message:
Skip bindings with agent_id=None

To avoid having extra L3HARouterAgentPortBinding with l3_agent as None,
operation of setting l3_agent should be atomic.
For this purpose, transaction was added in methods
create_ha_port_and_bind and _bind_ha_router_to_agents in change
Iaad82fe522cfd70061daecf411c924fdc11b7e41

In case if router was just created and l3 agent was not scheduled yet,
so l3_agent_id is None, l3-agent-list-hosting-router <router> will fail.
This change makes it work by skipping binding with agent_id=None.

Partial-bug: #1499647

Change-Id: I1aaf4b651f738febc26b0e1105aeabe066bca2a0

commit_message:
Fix restoring lnx2lnx patch after reboot on CentOS7/RHEL7

Change-Id: I148edd31b83e761184a3135570c9b20b8527896c
Closes-bug: #1522481

subject: Allow to fetch logs from the logrotated log files

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-09 18:01:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow to fetch logs from the logrotated log files

Current implementation allows to fetch data only from such files as
`puppet-apply.log`. But for now there is also rotated log files (logs
which are created by logrotate) such as, just for example,
`puppet-apply.log.1.gz`. Which should be also parsed and returned in
response. The functionality, which is included in this patch, does this.

Change-Id: I7dc2b330a95a3a97ed3b83925139135ed9cf4b1f
Closes-Bug: #1512280

commit_message:
Allow to fetch logs from the logrotated log files

Current implementation allows to fetch data only from such files as
`puppet-apply.log`. But for now there are also rotated log files (logs
which are created by logrotate) such as, just for example,
`puppet-apply.log.1.gz`. Which should be also parsed and returned in
response. The functionality, which is included in this patch, does this.

Closes-Bug: #1512280
Change-Id: I7dc2b330a95a3a97ed3b83925139135ed9cf4b1f

commit_message:
Fix the run_test unchecked pep8 W503 errors

Now thw flake8 did not check W503 error,
W503:doesn't allow binary ops at start of line,
And this patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I7b2cccee662bbabac381e82cad221803618f3065

subject: Remove default handling for 'RETRY' actions
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-10 04:38:34.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/scheduler.py'], 'message': "Remove default handling for 'RETRY' actions

An action with a RETRY return code will be set to READY status. This
READY action should be later scheduled by the scheduler for execution.
This patch removes the default behavior of restarting the action. The
logic is not right.

Change-Id: I339126ce62b12d9d01173df242f21cdab6305a86
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove default handling for 'RETRY' actions

An action with a RETRY return code will be set to READY status. This
READY action should be later scheduled by the scheduler for execution.
This patch removes the default behavior of restarting the action. The
logic is not right.

Change-Id: I339126ce62b12d9d01173df242f21cdab6305a86

Add system tests
Add system and failower tests for dvs_plugin test suite.
-add new functions create_network, create_subnet,
-add_router, add_sub_net_to_router in os_actions

commit_message:
Report bugs against openstack-api-site

For RST projects, set the launchpad project users report bugs against to
"openstack-api-site".

This variable will be used by the next openstackdocstheme update.

Closes-Bug: #1524476
Change-Id: I97a4ff8fd60ab5122724f856b695ad007e9b2fcb

commit_message:
Switch gnocchi to use os_service_default fact

This change switches the gnocchi module to use the os_service_default
fact for configuration options that default to '<SERVICE DEFAULT>'.

Related-bug: #1515273
Change-Id: I88f51a7025905b381c117675afc30a9ec1756c5b
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow specifying bug ref instead of BP

As Ironic moves towards deprecating Launchpad blueprints in favor
of Launchpad bugs, allow specifying bug reference instead of blueprint
in the spec proposed.

For backward compatibility both blueprint and bug references are
allowed.

Change-Id: I7bcfe4c2dfa1974a066260ca8d4aa02897a15ecf

2) removes PikaDriverCompatibleWithOldRabbit

commit_message:
Evacuate VMs from Compute node

In preparation phase of the upgrade of a node, evacuate virtual machines
from that node to other hosts using live migration.

This feature only supported for nodes where live migration is available.

Change-Id: I13a20b884aea1e3058a93f5459955b4d2a8a2089
Related-bug: 1523469

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-10 15:46:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Bind rabbitmq, epmd, and management plugin to internal IP

RabbitMQ itself was already listening on the correct IP
for controllers, but epmd and management plugin listened
everywhere (although management was covered by firewall
rules).

This covers all RabbitMQ server connection binding so that
all connections are done on the same IP address (with the
unfortunate side effect of blocking localhost connections).

Removed unused parameter rabbitmq_host from
nailgun::rabbitmq.

Change-Id: I9bfb8bc85fcd6d4711c4ca9d79745ad2ce7e673a
Closes-Bug: #1501731
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-10 16:15:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Bind rabbitmq, epmd, and management plugin to internal IP

for controllers, but epmd and management plugin listened
everywhere (although management was covered by firewall
rules).

commit_message:
Bind rabbitmq, epmd, and management plugin to internal IP

RabbitMQ itself was already listening on the correct IP
for controllers, but epmd and management plugin listened
everywhere (although management was covered by firewall
rules).

This covers all RabbitMQ server connection binding so that
all connections are done on the same IP address (with the
unfortunate side effect of blocking localhost connections).

Removed unused parameter rabbitmq_host from
nailgun::rabbitmq.

Change-Id: I9bfb8bc85fcd6d4711c4ca9d79745ad2ce7e673a
Closes-Bug: #1501731

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-04 09:10:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix broken "English" label in language-popover

CSS layout uses .popover-layout mixin, which fits the contents in a
pre-specified width (defaults to 260px). Popover classes include this
mixin so children widths are calculated during compile-time using Less
arithmetic expansions.

If a text node overflows the container word-wrapping rules would emerge
and cause this bug. Currently, offset calculations are implied by the
triangle arrow positioning stuff, which moves the popover container to
the right (using negative left offset) while moving the arrow (using
positive right offset). To preserve the correct layout, popover block
width should be known in prior.

Since the language menu has the leftmost offset, we can avoid these
calculations (still retaining current look-and-feel) by re-aligning the
arrow and setting the .language-popover left offset to zero. It would
allow as not to rely on a fixed width, so the box model will expand the
blocks as necessary to fit the text nodes.

Change-Id: I182a37da42bd546e72a57ba117b7be15ee187c5f
Closes-Bug: 1522341

commit_message:
Fix broken "English" label in language-popover

CSS layout uses .popover-layout mixin, which fits the contents in a
pre-specified width (defaults to 260px). Popover classes include this
mixin so children widths are calculated during compile-time using Less
arithmetic expansions.

If a text node overflows the container word-wrapping rules would emerge
and cause this bug. Currently, offset calculations are implied by the
triangle arrow positioning stuff, which moves the popover container to
the right (using negative left offset) while moving the arrow (using
positive right offset). To preserve the correct layout, popover block
width should be known in prior.

We can avoid these calculations (still retaining current look-and-feel)
by re-aligning the arrow, setting the .language-popover left offset to
zero and using CSS transformations to translate the whole block to the
left by the half of its width. It would allow as not to rely on a fixed
width, so the box model will expand the blocks as necessary to fit the
text nodes - on my screen it allows language names up to 16 narrow
chars (like 'a') or 10 wide chars ('A').

However, much simplier solution is just changing the padding of the
language name label. In case a longer word won't fit inside the
container, we can always update the @width parameter.

Closes-Bug: 1522341
Change-Id: I182a37da42bd546e72a57ba117b7be15ee187c5f

Remove Ceilometer Alarm from the undercloud

The Ceilometer alarm service is no longer available
in Mitaka. It is replaced by Aodh.

Aodh support is added in a follow-up to this patch.

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I60b149809335555d8375f0f128d5bd9b11dc86ea
Closes-bug: #1524824

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I79689d70d14239387f7ad9646eaf6cd2994ebcf7
Closes-bug: #1524824

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-11-13 02:17:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a GateDriver

As discussed at the summit, we are going to write a GateDriver
for testing purpose. This driver will inherit from the LVM driver
and implement missing functions for CG, replication, etc.

Implements: blueprint gate-driver
Change-Id: I1d5868a72741b80069656efc957cfb492889b36c
', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-11-20 05:13:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a GateDriver

Currently there are a few features that do not have a reference
implementation. These features include Consistency Group (CG),
replication, etc. As a result, any changes to CG and replication
cannot be easily tested. For example, when CG was converted to
versioned objects, developers who were working on the conversion
could not test CG functionality because LVM does not support it.

After the discussion at the summit on this subject, we have
decided to write a GateDriver for testing purpose. This driver
will inherit from the LVM driver and implement missing functions
for CG, replication, etc.

Implements: blueprint gate-driver
Change-Id: I1d5868a72741b80069656efc957cfb492889b36c
', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-11-20 21:40:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a GateDriver

Currently there are a few features that do not have a reference
implementation. These features include Consistency Group (CG),
replication, etc. As a result, any changes to CG and replication
cannot be easily tested. For example, when CG was converted to
versioned objects, developers who were working on the conversion
could not test CG functionality because LVM does not support it.

After the discussion at the summit on this subject, we have
decided to write a GateDriver for testing purpose. This driver
will inherit from the LVM driver and implement missing functions
for CG, replication, etc.

Implements: blueprint gate-driver
Change-Id: I1d5868a72741b80069656efc957cfb492889b36c
', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-12-02 04:10:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a GateDriver

Currently there are a few features that do not have a reference
implementation. These features include Consistency Group (CG),
replication, etc. As a result, any changes to CG and replication
cannot be easily tested. For example, when CG was converted to
versioned objects, developers who were working on the conversion
could not test CG functionality because LVM does not support it.

After the discussion at the summit on this subject, we have
decided to write a GateDriver for testing purpose. This driver
will inherit from the LVM driver and implement missing functions
for CG, replication, etc.

Implements: blueprint gate-driver
Change-Id: I1d5868a72741b80069656efc957cfb492889b36c
', 'number': 7}, {'created': '2015-12-02 22:43:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/fake_driver.py'], 'message': 'Add a FakeGateDriver

Currently there are a few features that do not have a reference

replication, etc. As a result, any changes to CG and replication
cannot be easily tested. For example, when CG was converted to
versioned objects, developers who were working on the conversion
could not test CG functionality because LVM does not support it.

This patch will add a FakeGateDriver to fake_driver.py under
tests/unit. This driver will inherit from the LVM driver and
implement functions for CG, replication, etc for testing
purpose only. This allows developers who do not have access to
a backend that supports these features to do some sanity testing
using the fake driver.

Related to this, tempest tests are submitted for CG APIs so that
third party CI can run them for drivers with CG support:

Implements: blueprint gate-driver

commit_message:
Add a FakeGateDriver

Currently there are a few features that do not have a reference
implementation. These features include Consistency Group (CG),
replication, etc. As a result, any changes to CG and replication
cannot be easily tested. For example, when CG was converted to
versioned objects, developers who were working on the conversion
could not test CG functionality because LVM does not support it.

This patch will add a FakeGateDriver to fake_driver.py under
tests/unit. This driver will inherit from the LVM driver and
implement functions for CG, replication, etc for testing
purpose only. This allows developers who do not have access to
a backend that supports these features to do some sanity testing
using the fake driver.

Related to this, tempest tests are submitted for CG APIs so that
third party CI can run them for drivers with CG support:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/252213/

Implements: blueprint gate-driver
Change-Id: I1d5868a72741b80069656efc957cfb492889b36c

commit_message:
Allow to set share visibility using "manage" API

This fix allows manila manage command to explicitly
set visibility (key '--public') similar to using API
"create".

Change-Id: I8725719b8c7ff5557fa20ebbb5314f3e770ffcc0
Closes-Bug: #1436865

commit_message:
Added new projects for the OSA role break out

The change adds new projects for the roles within OpenStack-Ansible
This is the second batch for the break out work which encompases the
OpenStack-Ansible play `setup-infrastructure.yml`.

New projects:
    - openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_client
    - openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server
    - openstack/openstack-ansible-memcached_server
    - openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_lock_down
    - openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server
    - openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_server
    - openstack/openstack-ansible-rsyslog_server

Governance Review: https://review.openstack.org/255372

Change-Id: Ia7509050693d81a4b3e01898ea4d5a6bfac3d598
Implements: blueprint independent-role-repositories
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

This patch makes names of Cinder client classes like

    Base<Resource>sClient and <Resource>sClient

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

commit_message:
Fix for bug "task stuck in RUNNING state"

The main cause was checking if all executions are complited
and setting state of execution in the same transaction. So in
case that two threads are running transactions simultanously
noone sees, that other action is ended. This commit split transaction
and add new method that will only change task state to SUCCESS, if
its in RUNNING state.

Closes-Bug: 1513456

Change-Id: I8235d6741c5de027cec81d167c739f7ec8ad0cab

commit_message:
Remove openstack_version file

/etc/fuel_openstack_version file is provided
by fuel-openstack-metadata package and can
be used to format paths where we put repos
and puppet modules during ISO build.
This patch removes all the lines that
assume direct using of openstack.yaml file.

Change-Id: I728fa53c16462bfb44328a619a151dc836573875
Closes-Bug: #1524359

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-10 01:21:33.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_neutron/tasks/neutron_post_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_neutron/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_neutron/templates/neutron.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Fix neutron issue w/ l2pop

This change resolves an issue where neutron is not able to bind to
a given port because l2 population is disabled and no vxlan multicast
group has been defined. To resolve this the `neutron_l2_population`
variable is being defined and set to "False" in the os_neutron defaults
and the vxlan multicast group will now contain a default value instead
of an empty string.

The change also removes the neutron_l2_population checks in the tasks
and templates because the variable is now being defined.

Change-Id: Ic2973626d88781bfc67a4275afcf9feffeb63f36
Closes-Bug: #1521793

(cherry picked from commit 00609ea56e09f5dd0488062b64a03420d296e614)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron issue w/ l2pop

This change resolves an issue where neutron is not able to bind to
a given port because l2 population is disabled and no vxlan multicast
group has been defined. To resolve this the `neutron_l2_population`
variable is being defined and set to "False" in the os_neutron defaults
and the vxlan multicast group will now contain a default value instead
of an empty string.

The change also removes the neutron_l2_population checks in the tasks
and templates because the variable is now being defined.

Change-Id: Ic2973626d88781bfc67a4275afcf9feffeb63f36
Closes-Bug: #1521793
Co-Authored-by: Ville Vuorinen <ville.vuorinen@multim.fi>
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 00609ea56e09f5dd0488062b64a03420d296e614)

Currently, if a deletion fails from the storage engine, the metric is
still expunged from the indexer, meaning metricd will not retry to

Let's make it retry by not expunging the metric from the indexer.

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
storage: retry to delete metric on failure

Currently, if a deletion fails from the storage engine, the metric is
still expunged from the indexer, meaning metricd will not retry to
delete it.

Let's make it retry by not expunging the metric from the indexer.

Change-Id: Id2c14cbbedda66aa3be4327a142f26415debf5db
(cherry picked from commit 63b0271856158414cbcb632bfed790fcb3d10917)

Currently, flush() is scheduled only _once_. Indeed, loop.call_later()
is not "recursive", as it does not reschedule every flush_delay seconds
the call. It only does it once!

commit_message:
statsd: fix flush() scheduling

Currently, flush() is scheduled only _once_. Indeed, loop.call_later()
is not "recursive", as it does not reschedule every flush_delay seconds
the call. It only does it once!
So let's build a closure that reschedule itself each time.

Change-Id: I2e16101890996a51cb2baa4ae7b21dd6d1e3c801

commit_message:
Make @truncated common for all backends

Although not used in all backends now, @truncated decorator can be
useful in all of them and there is no sense in making it sql-only.

Change-Id: I063cb1d621f4e2bf4d350450a56044d0b6cee7c1
Partial-Bug: 1501698

commit_message:
Fix exposition of bug about limiting with ldap

The test did not take into account that even with the limits set,
as part of some internal calculation we want to get the full list
of entities. Calling the API without a hints list should achieve
this, and return all available entries.

Drop the custom test and use generic LimitTests.

Change-Id: Id3120ed66cc23228edcf18e0177c1df1955ac5e7
Partial-Bug: 1501698

commit_message:
Fix T110 violation for database client

T110 requires methods, which calls GET, should be "list_<resource>s"
or "show_<resource>" as these names for consistency.
In addition, the other service clients doesn't contain "_details" on
the method names.
So this patch renames get_db_flavor_details to show_db_flavor on
database client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ia0b509ad9c4413c3ea9910e06d7c60c0c4f6896e

commit_message:
[V3] Rename get_policy to show_policy

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to policy client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ic4cfe4a5ec5695d943f7dca9579c545285fb2719

commit_message:
Make keepalived add_vip idempotent

L3 agent operations are designed to be idempotent to be resiliant
in the face of missed notifications, out of order notifications
processing and agent restarts. One exception is keepalived's
add_vip that was made to explicitly barf when the agent tries
to add a vip that was already inserted to keepalive'd internal
cache. This was done in patch 142630 by my request to root
out bugs. Well, we found such a bug and in retrospect may not
have been the smartest idea.

Change-Id: Iead975787e2847828286d7b644dcbe33cf57ace9
Related-Bug: #1523999

commit_message:
Validating message size

Received request's content should be validated if
its size does not exceed allowed value. Bytes refers
to byte size of the object instead of amount
of characters. This change is required in order
to reject those meesages that couldn't be processed
by Kafka queue.

Changed:
- added payload size validation to Python
- added validation of message size that it sent to Kafka
- reworked validation of message size in Java

Change-Id: I2acc647550d7c851a5715a7cf44f749db1f54d7b

commit_message:
Fix adding physical port to ovs bridge

When ovs provider is used for everything, deployments fail during task
netconfig.pp due to l2_port/ovs provider does not flush previous routes.

Change-Id: I1db11f55e309bf343ce98545eb6e6641b9872a49
Closes-bug: #1524294

commit_message:
Fix Linux.runCommand method

Added `eval` command to execution plan, which allows
to correctly execute user input

commit_message:
Add validate_with_client in BaseCustomConstraint

Since we replace not found error with EntityNotFound instead,
we can now consider use a common function for validate_with_client in most
of constraints. For some constraints that have a more complex validation will
overwrite the function(This is what we already used).

Change-Id: I1c554ba7848279cd60db1661fe7ebbd5b72235d8

commit_message:
Rename 'AVAILABLE_REGIONS' to 'AVAILABLE_KEYSTONE_ENDPOINTS'

This should remove a constant source of confusion when dealing with
regions-related issues (since 'AVAILABLE_REGIONS' gets mixed up with
Keystone regions).

Use utils.get_available_keystone_endpoints() method from
openstack_auth, which emits a deprecation notice in case an old
version of setting is used.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I482fb71e914131321090d9b2403303c7731e114b

creates a dispatcher abstraction

This change creates a dispatcher abstraction
to document the interface of a dispatcher.

And also allows in the futur to have attributes with default values.

commit_message:
Add 'delay-release' option to fuel projects

'Fix Commited' is used as a step for manual QA verification before
the bug is marked as 'Fix Released' for fuel projects, so we would
prefer to continue using 'delay-release' workflow.

* Add 'delay-release' option to all projects in 'fuel' group
* Add 'delay-release' option to fuel plugins in 'lma-toolchain' group

Change-Id: I50f766c0c3482cd5d9f0e2a7f0ba0f80faa054b6

commit_message:
Add sphinx doc build with tox

* Add basic doc build system with sphinx and tox
* Update README.md for how-to build docs
* Update .gitignore to exclude docs builds
* Add index and move README for Noop tests framework
* TODO split and add more details for how-to noop tests
  setup/use/create

Inspired by https://github.com/openstack/openstack-manuals

Partial-bug: #1483288

Change-Id: I982e0baaff5de95c7d0c4b3f098754a80676f0d0
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Refactor merge_settings_yaml provider add tests for it

* detach IO write operation into separate method and
  add exception's handling for it
* add tests for merge_settings_yaml provider

Closes-Bug: #1522543

commit_message:
Class ReloadNotifier added

Adds a class that signals callbacks when a service or launcher
receives a reload notification.

commit_message:
Exclude Horizon tmp directory from health checks

Corosync would stop the cluster if free space goes below critical
threshold. However Horizon tmp partition overfilling would not impact
cluster durability.

Change-Id: I9e20c8baaaef94fdeddc3b4d55f8ec35865fa115
Partial-Bug: #1518082

commit_message:
Add neutron agents to ironic node role when DVR is enabled

Ironic nodes requires neutron agents as well as regular nova-compute
when neutron DVR is enabled.

Change-Id: I8fc04727c0b4d6e55c2f0ff9f712cc9fddda6e8b
Closes-bug: #1522364

Use hiera_hash lookup for network_metadata

Replace hiera() with hiera_hash() for 'network_metadata' key to
provide override possibility.

Closes-bug: #1524336

Refactor action generator

When contributor wants to support new OpenStack service actions in
Mistral, there is no need to add different ActionGenerator classes
respectively and its corresponding unit tests.

commit_message:
[Verify] Fixing issue with running non-existing test suite

If we run some non-existing test suite, an error will happen while
parsing test results to put them into data base, and status of the
corresponding verification will be "verifying" instead of "failed".

Rally shouldn't put the results of non-existing tests into data base,
because there are no such tests and test results, and status of the
corresponding verification should be set to "failed".

Closes-Bug: #1520952

Change-Id: I2c9476e334125b08d3e28ce2949ec43fe99cfe24

[{'created': '2015-12-07 07:14:26.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc files during tox runs, certain
changes in the tree, like deletes of files, or switching

Closes-Bug: #1368661
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc files during tox runs, certain
changes in the tree, like deletes of files, or switching
branches, can create spurious errors.

Change-Id: I2d0253b0305792862111db8b1e7adc2289863ee3
Closes-Bug: #1368661

commit_message:
volumes_links attribute not allowd in volume list

When GETting os-volumes, the returned list of volumes respects the
osapi_max_limit configuration parameter but does not provide a link to
the next element in the list.
But volumes_links attribute not allowd in volume list. We need to add
volumes_links attribute in tempest.

Change-Id: I22436e33d640b6ca6bf15a7f582d0cef46d30565
Closes-Bug: 1504641

commit_message:
Change info log message to warning on graceful shutdown timeout exceeding

graceful shutdown timeout insures that service will not wait forever.
If graceful shutdown timeout is exceeded service is closed
instantaneously(not graceful) and it can mean that server or client
contains shutdown bug.

Change-Id: I880afffec67cec31cb9fc033881f20b0e0a1c376

commit_message:
Added processing /compute URL for getting list of versions

After implementing blueprint "Ability to run some Nova services under Apache2"(
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/run-nova-services-under-apache2)
it becomes possible not to use separate ports for each openstack service but
share 80 port with different URL prefixes. Mailing list thread with
discussion the details of this feature:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067147.html.
Openstack wiki page with mapping urls to services:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/URLs.

If nova-api service is started by Apache (or similar),
using 'Alias' directive script name contains alias-prefix.
We get things like: '/ALIAS/NAME/v2', '/ALIAS/NAME/v2.1'

This change makes sure we compose correct url for getting list of versions.

Change-Id: Ibf7937aca468f75a99e171a9495673bf8f446b01

commit_message:
add seperate job for monasca plugin in devstack install

* extend devstack-rally-gate with monasca plugin
* add job-template for monasca test in rally.yaml
* add monasca test run in layout.yaml
* add monasca to all jobs use devstack-rally-gate builder
* add monasca job in projects.yaml

Change-Id: Iefc212c1d1cbfae998b505b9a3d041adf7e43015

commit_message:
[user-guides] Update dashboard navigation for Liberty

This patch covers End User Guide only.
Admin User Guide is not included, which is covered at another patch.

Change-Id: I3a2f001cf655c29118c14d484c45c3ff2ee7104c
Closes-Bug: #1376365
Closes-Bug: #1524012
Implements: blueprint user-guides-reorganised

commit_message:
Synced requirements with global requirements

We have issues with coverage job and during the debugging
of coverage script I found the issue with incorrect
requirements and incorrect tox version.

After this fix coverage script will work fine.

Change-Id: I4731dd735abc6ea13a084952688c3b0257f6d7e1
Closes-Bug: #1523959

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-(diskimage-builder|jenkins-job-builder)

Here we are just adding ansible-role-diskimage-builder and
ansible-role-jenkins-job-builder into the OpenStack gerrit workflow.

After talking with both openstack-infra and third party CI teams it
was decided to deal with which team this would be part of a later
date.

Additionally, we have not created a launchpad project for this module
or pypi (since we won't release there).

Gerritbot was also not configured at this time, since we don't know
which team we are going to be part of.

Change-Id: I18397f709059e3c4455f3fe9df2be08a6993fe7f
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Ie98057a71fe516c6c96e6ac88cc5540ed9d6966d

Remove keystoneclient tests

These tests don't improve test coverage, and keystoneclient
is tested adequately already in its own tests.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-19 13:53:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Added CORS support to Neutron

This adds the CORS support middleware to Neutron, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly. Included
are Neutron's custom headers, so that anyone activating this
middleware does not have to explicitly enable them.

For neutron, the paste.ini method of deploying the middleware was
chosen, because it needs to be able to annotate responses created
by keystonemiddleware. If the middleware were explicitly included
as in the previous patch, keystone would reject the request before
the cross-domain headers could be annotated, resulting in an
error response that was unreadable by the user agent.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html

Change-Id: I02acea6124d28370d92e7c94ca2d1d6c5c8937ac

', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-11-11 19:33:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Added CORS support to Neutron

This adds the CORS support middleware to Neutron, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

For neutron, both the paste.ini and the direct-wrap method of
deploying the middleware were chosen, since neutron is in a state of
migration to pecan. Note that if someone deploys pecan-neutron behind
other middleware, any responses provided by that middleware will not
be CORS-enabled, as these responses would be returned before the
headers could be annotated. This results in a response not readable
by the user agent.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html
DocImpact

commit_message:
Added CORS support to Neutron

This adds the CORS support middleware to Neutron, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

For neutron, both the paste.ini and the direct-wrap method of
deploying the middleware were chosen, since neutron is in a state of
migration to pecan. Note that if someone deploys pecan-neutron behind
other middleware, any responses provided by that middleware will not
be CORS-enabled, as these responses would be returned before the
headers could be annotated. This results in a response not readable
by the user agent.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html
DocImpact: Add link to CORS configuration in admin cloud guide.

Change-Id: I02acea6124d28370d92e7c94ca2d1d6c5c8937ac

commit_message:
refactor: move the common code to manager layer

There are some methods (`_get_endpoint_groups_for_project` and
`_get_endpoints_filtered_by_endpoint_group`) needed both by catalog
controller and manager, move those methods into manager so that
controller can call these methods directly from manager.

Change-Id: I3a82c606d62bc2ad54f7454cd6ee4dbce0b88219
Related-Bug: #1516469

commit_message:
Add shell --profile option to trigger osprofiler from CLI

Currently the only way to trigger osprofiler (tracing) is to use
python-keystoneclient as is and python lib. This patch add new option
--profile that will do this from CLI.

So if you have installed osprofiler lib and you will type

keystone --profile SECRET_KEY user-lsit

At the end of output there will be message with <trace_id>
to plot nice HTML graphs use command:

osprofiler trace show <trace_id> --html --out result.html

Based on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/114856/

Related patch:
(main patch in keystone) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/103368/

Change-Id: I534fdd8c55885b9d6d9ba2443a7d90b8144b5d1e

subject: Fix concurrency issues by using READ_COMMITTED
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-10 08:21:30.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/base.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_workflow_resume.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/services/test_trigger_service.py', 'mistral/db/sqlalchemy/base.py', 'mistral/tests/functional/api/v2/test_mistral_basic_v2.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/db/v2/test_locking.py', 'releasenotes/notes/changing-isolation-level-to-read-committed-7080833ad284b901.yaml', 'mistral/db/v2/api.py', 'mistral/tests/resources/wf_task_ex_concurrency.yaml', 'mistral/tests/functional/base.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'mistral/tests/resources/wf_action_ex_concurrency.yaml', 'mistral/engine/default_engine.py'], 'message': 'Fix concurrency issues by using READ_COMMITTED

The state of a workflow execution was not updated even when all task
executions were completed if some tasks finished at the same time as
other tasks.
Because we were using our connections with transaction isolation
level = REPEATABLE_READ - Each process was using a snapshot of the DB
created at the first read statement in that transaction.
When a task finished and evaluated the state of all the other tasks
it did not see the up-to-date state of those tasks - and so, because
not all tasks were completed - the task did not change the workflow
execution state.

Similar behavior happened with multiple action executions under same
task. On completion, each action execution checked the status of the
other action executions and did not see the up-to-date state of these
action execution - causing task execution to stay in RUNNING state.

Change-Id: I12f66134d92b8ed39df9d6128d7de5ee49aa8623
Closes-Bug: #1518012
Closes-Bug: #1513456
(cherry picked from commit 976667c0a22f604559e19135f30dea803e3080f6)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix concurrency issues by using READ_COMMITTED

The state of a workflow execution was not updated even when all task
executions were completed if some tasks finished at the same time as
other tasks.
Because we were using our connections with transaction isolation
level = REPEATABLE_READ - Each process was using a snapshot of the DB
created at the first read statement in that transaction.
When a task finished and evaluated the state of all the other tasks
it did not see the up-to-date state of those tasks - and so, because
not all tasks were completed - the task did not change the workflow
execution state.

Similar behavior happened with multiple action executions under same
task. On completion, each action execution checked the status of the
other action executions and did not see the up-to-date state of these
action execution - causing task execution to stay in RUNNING state.

Change-Id: I12f66134d92b8ed39df9d6128d7de5ee49aa8623
Closes-Bug: #1518012
Closes-Bug: #1513456
(cherry picked from commit 976667c0a22f604559e19135f30dea803e3080f6)

This code is not useful because we have only one version 
of watcher db currently and this alembic revision is out
of date compared to the initial schema as of mitaka-1.

commit_message:
Rename command to action_plan

Some Python class and packages need to be renamed
for a better compliance with the shared terminology
which provides a better understanding of Watcher
objects and components by every contributor.

This patchset is there to change command to action_plan

Partially implements: blueprint glossary-related-refactoring

Change-Id: I19a70adeca347ce747a2221b5fc31658139c95a2

commit_message:
Cluster creation wizard ported to components

Cluster creation wizard switched to the components API.
Removed support of the old config-based wizard metadata

Change-Id: Ic017679aaf38b011532f0c2db05e09d745fbf3d1
Implements: blueprint component-registry

subject: Fix concurrency issues by using READ_COMMITTED

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-05 15:47:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix concurrency issues by using READ_COMMITTED

The state of a workflow execution was not updated even when all task
executions were completed if some tasks finished at the same time as
other tasks.
Because we were using our connections with transaction isolation
level = REPEATABLE_READ - Each process was using a snapshot of the DB
created at the first read statement in that transaction.
When a task finished and evaluated the state of all the other tasks
it did not see the up-to-date state of those tasks - and so, because
not all tasks were completed - the task did not change the workflow
execution state.

Similar behavior happened with multiple action executions under same
task. On completion, each action execution checked the status of the
other action executions and did not see the up-to-date state of these
action execution - causing task execution to stay in RUNNING state.

Change-Id: I12f66134d92b8ed39df9d6128d7de5ee49aa8623
Closes-Bug: #1518012

executions were completed if some tasks finished at the same time as
other tasks.
Because we were using our connections with transaction isolation
level = REPEATABLE_READ - Each process was using a snapshot of the DB
created at the first read statement in that transaction.
When a task finished and evaluated the state of all the other tasks
it did not see the up-to-date state of those tasks - and so, because
not all tasks were completed - the task did not change the workflow
execution state.

Similar behavior happened with multiple action executions under same
task. On completion, each action execution checked the status of the
other action executions and did not see the up-to-date state of these
action execution - causing task execution to stay in RUNNING state.

commit_message:
Fix concurrency issues by using READ_COMMITTED

The state of a workflow execution was not updated even when all task
executions were completed if some tasks finished at the same time as
other tasks.
Because we were using our connections with transaction isolation
level = REPEATABLE_READ - Each process was using a snapshot of the DB
created at the first read statement in that transaction.
When a task finished and evaluated the state of all the other tasks
it did not see the up-to-date state of those tasks - and so, because
not all tasks were completed - the task did not change the workflow
execution state.

Similar behavior happened with multiple action executions under same
task. On completion, each action execution checked the status of the
other action executions and did not see the up-to-date state of these
action execution - causing task execution to stay in RUNNING state.

Change-Id: I12f66134d92b8ed39df9d6128d7de5ee49aa8623
Closes-Bug: #1518012
Closes-Bug: #1513456

commit_message:
fix mongo create database

Mongodb guestagent was raising an exception when trying to create a
new database because the os_admin user did not have permissions to
write to any database in mongo.

Added the role readWriteAnyDatabase to the os_admin user and this
resolved this issue.

Change-Id: Id81bf64515600f92ddfcea995b82ab0d5afb5071
Closes-Bug: #1517194

commit_message:
skip ironic client dsvm and pypy gates for doc patches

For document patches, these gates are not required:

gate-python-ironicclient-pypy
gate-tempest-dsvm-python-ironicclient-src
gate-ironicclient-dsvm-functional

So they will be skiped by this patch.

Change-Id: I8204450a79a37204d9223f1a5328e376954978e6

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-08 21:19:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix devops create method

This change fixes the regression introduced by change
Iad081bee94c4d3b404eda57b7c1c31011b837ba7 which broke the use of the
'dos.py create' shell command. The refactoring of the Environment to
support templates removed the networks from being properly defined via
the create method which resulted in UUIDs not being properly generated
for the networks. Additionaly the Environment.create_interfaces
function was changed but not updated in all places where it was used.

This change ensures the networks are defined prior to the creation of
the admin node for the create command and updates the node model so
that it can properly be attached to networks.

Change-Id: I965f647285d8eca28a71a2d31708eee7a6d36b4d
Closes-Bug: #1521520

commit_message:
Fix devops create method

This change fixes the regression introduced by change
Iad081bee94c4d3b404eda57b7c1c31011b837ba7 which broke the use of the
'dos.py create' shell command. The refactoring of the Environment to
support templates changed when the nodes and networks get defined and
saved in the DB. Since the ordering changed, this creation of the admin
node via the do_create method no longer works. Additionaly the
Environment.create_interfaces function was changed but not updated in
all places where it was used. This change adds the previous verison of
the function back as create_interfaces_from_networks.

This change ensures the networks are defined prior to the creation of
the admin node for the create command, slave nodes are created as part
of the do_create function and updates the node model so that it can
properly be attached to networks.

Change-Id: I965f647285d8eca28a71a2d31708eee7a6d36b4d
Closes-Bug: #1521520

commit_message:
Add rally integration point

This folder is used to define the rally tests scenarios
run for Kuryr gate job.
This also allow to create Kuryr specific rally plugins
and use them in scenarios in the gate job.

implements blueprint: rally-kuryr-testing

Change-Id: I73078fffbf5707740a58be70902d5cb5a95fc074

[{'created': '2015-12-04 17:11:15.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Remove version from setup.cfg

Per [1] we now use the git repository for knowing the version instead

of modifying the setup.cfg file.

commit_message:
Add 'is_still_owner' lock test function

Distributed locks have the tendency to become acquired
and then after this point, perhaps becoming unacquired since
locks are typically on a remote machine and things like
network disconnects and such can (and do) happen causing
the running application to need an ability to check if it
is still the owner of the lock (and react appropriately).

Change-Id: I31a79a093c14c31b47f7f0b2a7bb06d77a793186

subject: Force basepython=python2.7
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-04 04:30:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Force basepython=python2.7

launchpadlib 0.0.1.dev533 requires lazr.restfulclient, which contains
python2-only syntax (at least as of lazr.restfulclient 0.13.1).  On a
system where "tox" uses python3 (eg: Debian "stretch"), the default
basepython will be python3, and venv creation (pip building wheels) will
fail on lazr.restfulclient.

This patch forces basepython=python2.7 across all testenvs.

Change-Id: I44f4c6f819550a8a586ae19bbed45fc9b67dd1c0
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-10 07:30:23.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Force basepython=python2.7

launchpadlib 0.0.1.dev533 requires lazr.restfulclient, which contains
python2-only syntax (at least as of lazr.restfulclient 0.13.1).  On a
system where "tox" uses python3 (eg: Debian "stretch"), the default
basepython will be python3, and venv creation (pip building wheels) will
fail on lazr.restfulclient.

This patch forces basepython=python2.7 across all testenvs.

Change-Id: I44f4c6f819550a8a586ae19bbed45fc9b67dd1c0
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Force basepython=python2.7

launchpadlib 0.0.1.dev533 requires lazr.restfulclient, which contains
python2-only syntax (at least as of lazr.restfulclient 0.13.1).  On a
system where "tox" uses python3 (eg: Debian "stretch"), the default
basepython will be python3, and venv creation (pip building wheels) will
fail on lazr.restfulclient.

This patch forces basepython=python2.7 across all testenvs.

Change-Id: I44f4c6f819550a8a586ae19bbed45fc9b67dd1c0

commit_message:
[autohelp] allow overrides of sections

We want to be able to change the section in which an option is
registered in the documentation. This patch uses a <project>.overrides
file to define in which section(s) an option should be moved.

The format of this file is (1 line per option):
[<group>/]<option> <new_group1>[ <new_group2> ... ]

Change-Id: I9fd0b763b6e56cd360694566de7f3acc3172c9c1
Closes-Bug: #1522794

commit_message:
glusterfs: add missing i18n import

Also remove unnecessary fake _ function
from the test suite so that other possible
occurrences of this genre of bug would be
detected by unit tests.

Change-Id: I8292fceda02442f83210e98cee4619c81bc181e5
Closes-Bug: #1506297

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-24 08:15:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactor BarbicanAuth to allow for configurable auth method

There is now a new configuration option "barbican_auth" in the
certificates section, to specify with auth plugin to use when
communicating with Barbican. This is because the default option (using
ACLs inside Barbican to control access) should be ok as a default
workflow, but it might be required to use other methods depending on
your deployment. For example, another possible auth method would be
BarbicanTrustAuth, utilizing Keystone Trusts.

Rackspace will be using an internal auth method that does not exist in
upstream Keystone, and will need its own Auth plugin. This should be in line
with the way Octavia's network and compute drivers work already.

Change-Id: Ic9aef68924bb5c216734afd25403e59476c576e7

commit_message:
Refactor BarbicanAuth to allow for configurable auth method

There is now a new configuration option "barbican_auth" in the
certificates section, to specify which auth plugin to use when
communicating with Barbican. This is because the default option (using
ACLs inside Barbican to control access) should be ok as a default
workflow, but it might be required to use other methods depending on
your deployment. For example, another possible auth method would be
BarbicanTrustAuth, utilizing Keystone Trusts.

Some deployers may need custom auth methods that do not exist in
upstream Keystone, and will need their own Auth plugin. This should be in line
with the way Octavia's network and compute drivers work already.

While we're in this file, prune the unused (and really bad) method that
would *actually* delete certs from Barbican (not in our scope).
Also do the tenant_id -> project_id rename.

Change-Id: Ic9aef68924bb5c216734afd25403e59476c576e7

commit_message:
Fixes dict keys and items references for Python 3

Python 3 does not support indexing keys or items iterators.

Removes unit tests from tests-py3.txt blacklist.

Partially implements blueprint: nova-python3-mitaka

Change-Id: I3ec1e775d91e7f56356f744fd80f5d9df36cae1d

revisions:

Related-bug: #1524418

Change-Id: Ic1ddec2d13172532dbaa572d04a4c22c97ac4fe7
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-09 17:54:10.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "Don't trigger error_callback for known exc

When AMQPDestinationNotFound is raised, we must not
call the error_callback method. The exception is logged

commit_message:
Don't trigger error_callback for known exc

When AMQPDestinationNotFound is raised, we must not
call the error_callback method. The exception is logged
only if needed in upper layer (amqpdriver.py).

Related-bug: #1524418

Change-Id: Ic1ddec2d13172532dbaa572d04a4c22c97ac4fe7

Ignore exception on router interface delete if router deleted

Ignore exception on router interface if the interface was
already deleted or the logical router doesnt exist.

commit_message:
Make node-create --chassis_uuid required

chassis_uuid should be required as well as driver because both
of them are mandatory_attrs in Ironic API, which means they cannot
be empty.

Change-Id: I4f8a15bb78919ffea14f745e5d0e9657c028752d

subject: Fix Keystone Identity V3 Trust API URL
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-10 03:18:52.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/identity-api/src/v3/wadl/OS-TRUST-v3.wadl'], 'message': 'Fix Keystone Identity V3 Trust API URL

URI for POST Trust API is not correct - it should be /v3/OS-TRUST/trusts

http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-identity-v3-ext.html#createTrust

Now Tempest is using these ref as Documents for their service client and
found this issue.

Change-Id: I80a8d7df769fe9e767859462eee31e2f86f60026
Closes-Bug: #1524585
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix Keystone Identity V3 Trust API URL

URI for POST Trust API is not correct - it should be /v3/OS-TRUST/trusts

http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-identity-v3-ext.html#createTrust

Now Tempest is using these ref as Documents for their service client and
found this issue.

Change-Id: I80a8d7df769fe9e767859462eee31e2f86f60026
Closes-Bug: #1524585

commit_message:
Allow passing version as '2' as well as '2.0'

Currently python-neutronclient and python-openstackclient have different
views of what OS_NETWORK_API_VERSION should be. Rather than fighting a
land war, how about we make both things accept both things, since it's
generally understandable by humans that '2' and '2.0' are the same
thing.

Change-Id: Ibf3c14e15b19c1aca696ce5c693588565a73a524

commit_message:
Correct DHCP configuration examples

The intermediate chain loader URL, for our TFTP configuration
requires a leading / to match the file in order to serve up the
user's request.

Added leading "/" to the configuration examples.

Change-Id: I8bec59400f013b2912f836b3619bea2e078f564c
Closes-Bug: #1524505

commit_message:
Remove local copy of api doc

The Senlin API doc is now contributed to api-site project, and it is
online here: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-clustering-v1.html.
We don't need to maintain a local copy of it.

Change-Id: I048dd4230fd111dfbaaebf1994b38491b8661f29

commit_message:
Make v2 create_user_ec2_credentials  use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.

This patch makes create_user_ec2_credentials of v2 identity_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I84b62041ee5e3811e9651ece2323b1f52065ff91

commit_message:
Call _persist_state for UPDATE in 'state_set'

UPDATE flow doesn't call 'state_set', to set the state.
However, this is called in 'set_stack_and_resource_to_failed',
to set the stack status to FAILED. This includes reset during
stack UPDATE.

With https://review.openstack.org/#/c/245810/5, we removed UPDATE
from persisting the state as part of releasing the lock. This has
resulted in the state not being persisted for UPDATE when
'reset_stack_status' is called.

Change-Id: I8a80e329604fdec6498acca0a71723100d412384
Closes-Bug: #1523717

commit_message:
Use Tempest-lib's compute volumes_client

Compute volumes_client has been migrated to
tempest-lib- I10913f82dc3d0bef53edd67144cb47580d3c574d

Now Tempest-lib provides this client as stable interface so Tempest
should start using this from lib and remove its own copy.
Also remove its unit tests.

This commit makes Tempest to use compute volumes_client
from Tempest-lib.

Change-Id: I9909c96d6f7003a09f7694b1b1d7feac894b998f

commit_message:
Add Rally benchmarking hooks to Dragonflow

Once a rally job is configured in project-config, the
dragonflow.yaml file and scenarios will run in the gate
with Dragonflow as a plugin.
It is easy to extend and add new rally plugins and scenarios
in this repository to be used.

Change-Id: I3257acec07d0b62186fdcc27375f8237d1f0d2cc

commit_message:
Ensure endpoints returned is filtered correctly

This patch move some logic to manager layer, so that endpoints
filtered by endpoint_group project association will be included
in catalog when issue a project scoped token and using
`endpoint_filter.sql` as catalog's backend driver.

This make sure that call `list_endpoints_for_project` API has
the same endpoints with that in catalog returned for project
scoped token.

Change-Id: I56f4eb6fc524650677b627295dd4338d55164c39
Closes-Bug: #1516469

commit_message:
Enable py3 mock.patch of RuntimeError

RuntimeError is moved to builtins in Python3.x so adjust
the @mock.patch accordingly when running in Python3.x.

Change-Id: I5e1ce3ed40add635ce25bc1d80f88dc7ad9d2c59
Closes-Bug: #1522551

commit_message:
Pework functional tests of cluster_list and node_list

This patch revises functional test of cluster_list and node_list
to improve their robustness. They now verify specific cluster/node
id exists in returned list rather than the length of list.

Change-Id: Ice7af7e6f5d82ce054e5cc5df3ad9d047def343c

commit_message:
Add get_file support for senlinclient

SenlinClient should support get_file in spec.
Like following:

type: os.heat.stack
version: 1.0
properties:
  name: random_string_stack
  template:
    get_file: random_string_stack.yaml
  context:
    region_name: RegionOne
  environment:
    - get_file: env.yaml

Change-Id: I7076bdaa1bdb225171b18491c4e521ef6e7b94ae
Closes-Bug: #1510376

commit_message:
Shorten the event ID in log output for reability

The current event log output contains a long event ID that is rarely
helpful in distinguishing events from each other. This patch proposes
logging the "short ID" of the object.

Change-Id: Ie78b4c6f0a97d9f7330ccf2e3de3455acd8b1308

commit_message:
Improve logging in functional testings

The default logging output from functional test is too verbose to find
any useful information. This patch tries to raise the logging level so
that only useful information from the engine or the api are logged.

Change-Id: Ie68f5a752a87cf277e7fbccc01455dd121f186a5

commit_message:
[config-ref] Include neutron config files

For Mitaka, neutron implements automatic generation of sample
configuration files and removes static sample configuration
files from the neutron source tree. Therefore, the
configuration reference must include local versions of
sample configuration files similar to other projects that
implement automatic generation of sample configuration files.

Change-Id: If92d048a837ffbd9ba8664559ddabe886f448a32
Closes-Bug: #1520722

commit_message:
Use include for swift::storage::${type}

Require operator specify swiftinit provider
on supported components rather then pass it through.

commit_message:
Import i18n functions directly

Import i18n functions from module directly and do not use
global module variables like _ = i18n._. It makes code shorter
and cleaner. It also to detect cases when these functions are not
used in module.

Change-Id: Iaa593ac1f2dd15cbcad049bef6ba68f1cfa610da

commit_message:
Notify about port create/update unconditionally

The notification about port create/update should be done no matter
if host (or any other field) was changed or not - it should be up to
handler to decide how to handle it.

This also fixes the bug when there was actually no notification to l3
dvr agent on compute node on new port creation:
_get_host_port_if_changed() always returned None - this is a regression
from commit 2ee08c3464c53abaf9bc5493132ad7958611e3b8

Closes-Bug: #1521524
Change-Id: I5bb416d2aaab632526f06a5620c0a4ea96340d21
(cherry picked from commit 87ce73141dddb840ffc523f253fdf87aef11d1c7)

initiator IQN in the LIO ACL vs. the IQN provided

commit_message:
LIO: Handle initiator IQNs as case insensitive

If there is a mismatch in case between the stored
initiator IQN in the LIO ACL vs. the IQN provided
in a later call, rtstool would fail to find the
existing ACL.

Compare IQNs in a case insensitive manner to ensure
they will always match as intended.  (Refer to RFC
3720 section 3.2.6.1 for details on this.)

Closes-Bug: #1522053

Change-Id: I6f535f3f4fbfcbbb49da30cffb08d17b3cac778a

commit_message:
Added test coverage for toast.service.js

Test coverage added to framework/widgets/toast/toast.service.js and
modified multiple tests to handle type of 'error', which was not tested
before.

Closes-Bug: #1499142

commit_message:
Add Guru Meditation Reports support to Neutron services

This new feature allows services to dump valuable debug info to stderr
on SIGUSR2 signal.

Change-Id: If17b57f687558e23b830eae5ee1f8900356355e4
Implements: blueprint guru-meditation-report

commit_message:
Add libvirt-python to ceilometer hosts

Ceilometer utilizes the libvirt library for gathering
instance related metrics. This commit adds the package
to the ceilometer hosts.

Change-Id: I1e46a9a49b606e11cd12f06ce947990096b1ad08
Closes-Bug: #1522250
(cherry picked from commit edf69b4969d7c3bf98db358b7a2c7894e5c4113a)

commit_message:
Use project throughout openrc

This is less ambitious than trying to convert the entire world to use v3
authentication. For now simply replace OS_TENANT_NAME with OS_PROJECT_NAME
because all the CLIs should be able to handle that by now.

Change-Id: If473b2eb74d26afa5ff22b7ab6afca25878b923e

commit_message:
Allow saving and caching the plugin auth state

Particularly for allowing the CLI to store and reuse previous
authentication allow an application to extract and reinstall the
auth state from a plugin.

Implements: bp cachable-auth
Change-Id: I4eebe7ff8060a37f19af5decfa3a8313cfb7c207

commit_message:
Use certmonger for certs

Replace custom openssl certificate generation with calls to the
certmonger local CA. Ideally we would use the certmaster backend for
devstack however it lacks some features we require.

Change-Id: Ib0164bb27233e2b67b1580ce350a5ea9e4330834

commit_message:
Make root_stack_id determination more robust

If a stack with stack_id does not exist, then the
function should return None.

Change-Id: Ib1670be42d092629d97552b79960cdcf0ace1fb2
Closes-Bug: #1524472

commit_message:
Fix decription for admins Image create modal

Current admins image create modal
description/helpbox contains inaccurate
description.
Glance can store compressed images, but
Nova can't boot from compressed images.
This patch deletes mentioning compressed
images as supported type for admin
page.

Change-Id: I1e8972688d096692c6746f7a2f4a2dcf71ffabbf
Partial-Bug: #1479966
Co-Authored-By: Alan Fung<wingfung@cisco.com>

subject: Statically handle default auth options
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-10 07:03:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Statically handle default auth options

Don't compile all the possible auth options for everything on the system
into the --help text of OSC. Keystoneclient handles this by only
registering the options specified in --os-auth-plugin. Do something
similar for OSC and make it so that if the user doesn't provide a plugin
we handle the options manually so we don't get messed up by plugins that
do weird things.

Change-Id: I609204172deacd76bde7edbd5096aee310eeb716
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-13 04:29:48.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'openstackclient/api/auth.py', 'openstackclient/tests/common/test_clientmanager.py', 'openstackclient/shell.py', 'openstackclient/identity/client.py'], 'message': "Statically handle default auth options

Don't compile all the possible auth options for everything on the system
into the --help text of OSC. Keystoneclient handles this by only
registering the options specified in --os-auth-plugin. Do something
similar for OSC and make it so that if the user doesn't provide a plugin
we handle the options manually so we don't get messed up by plugins that
do weird things.

Change-Id: I609204172deacd76bde7edbd5096aee310eeb716
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Statically handle default auth options

Don't compile all the possible auth options for everything on the system
into the --help text of OSC. Keystoneclient handles this by only
registering the options specified in --os-auth-plugin. Do something
similar for OSC and make it so that if the user doesn't provide a plugin
we handle the options manually so we don't get messed up by plugins that
do weird things.

Change-Id: I609204172deacd76bde7edbd5096aee310eeb716

commit_message:
Load auth plugins directly

There is no need for OSC to determine a plugin name and then look that
up in stevedore. If it knows the plugin it wants then it should access
it directly. This means we don't add new plugins to the global stevedore
pool because these plugins are available to everything on the system.

Centralize all the hacks for loading these plugins. It's a big function
but now there is one place where you give some options and you get back
a plugin. This will make it easier to refactor later where we have the
same pattern.

Change-Id: I44f720cf43f6a7d0a19a10760a0f63e1a48af09e

options from a CLI. This will remove some handling from OSC as well as

commit_message:
Use keystoneclient's session loading from CLI

The keystoneclient provides a standard mechanism for loading transport
options from a CLI. This will remove some handling from OSC as well as
give it the ability to specify client certificates.

This removes the verify parameter from the ClientManager as this is an
option that is handled by the session loading mechanism. The verify
argument that is not provided by keystoneclient is mapped to the
insecure parameter that is.

Change-Id: I7deb0489c6237465608521d8750fbca2ea24aa65

commit_message:
Add "vnc" option group for sample nova.conf file

There is no "[vnc]" section in nova.conf.sample generated by
command "tox -egenconfig".
In addition, the "[default]" section has vnc options.

This patch moves vnc options from "[default]" section to
"[vnc]" section.

Change-Id: I5cf69729aa9e2bb868f26b82eaaa28187ce7a7a3
Closes-Bug: #1506356

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 21:48:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Move quota checks from manager to API

Currently quotas are sometimes checked in cinder.volume.manager,
and other times checked in cinder.volume.api. This patch is the
second of two commits that aim to make these checks more consistent
by moving calls from the manager to the API. This way, we can give
the user feedback before launching the RPC call.

APIImpact
Closes-bug: #1508249
Change-Id: I081b4172d0c57f20239ace2ec3f2c16bb19d3d9b

commit_message:
Move consistency group quota checks to API

Currently quotas are sometimes checked in cinder.volume.manager,
and other times checked in cinder.volume.api. This patch is the
second of two commits that aim to make these checks more consistent
by moving calls from the manager to the API. This way, we can give
the user feedback before launching the RPC call. If the quotas fail
to update, an exception will be raised in the API to inform the user
before the action takes place unless the force option is set to True.

APIImpact
Closes-bug: #1508249
Depends-On: I49e3e2bf3e1621e9e8d9645b7ad09154ffb448c3
Change-Id: I081b4172d0c57f20239ace2ec3f2c16bb19d3d9b

[{'created': '2015-05-29 17:18:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Adding download for openrc file for keystone v3

The existing openrc file download only works for keystone v2. Regardless
of whether v3 is enabled in Horizon.

This adds support for both. A v2.0 and a v3 compatible openrc file
download. A couple of different situations are covered.

1) support for keystone v2 only: OPENSTACK_API_VERSION={'identity': 2.0}
In this case only the v2 option is shown.

2) Use of keystone v3 in a potentially mixed environment. Since it is
possible to use keystone v2 and v3 in the same enviroment, having
OPENSTACK_API_VERSION={'identity': 3} displays options for downloading
v2 or v3 compatible openrc files.

Closes-Bug: #1460150

commit_message:
Adding download for openrc file for keystone v3

The existing openrc file download only works for keystone v2. Regardless
of whether v3 is enabled in Horizon.

This adds support for both. A v2.0 and a v3 compatible openrc file
download. A couple of different situations are covered.

1) support for keystone v2 only: OPENSTACK_API_VERSION={'identity': 2.0}
In this case only the v2 option is shown.

2) Use of keystone v3 in a potentially mixed environment. Since it is
possible to use keystone v2 and v3 in the same enviroment, having
OPENSTACK_API_VERSION={'identity': 3} displays options for downloading
v2 or v3 compatible openrc files.

Rationale for making the existing methods and urls support v3+. By
moving the v2.0 functionality to new version specific methods, they can
be more easily excised when v2 is obsolete and we're left with the newer
version support.

Change-Id: I29c62dc7436cc39adc1a4af9d90ceb6767e7a177
Closes-Bug: #1460150

commit_message:
Use assertDictEqual instead of assertEqualPolicies

The assertEqualPolicies methods was recently refactored
(I7b6ec22430fcffae69cab1b276e41390314be5cc) to only call assertDictEqual. This
change removes assertEqualPolicies in place of assertDictEqual, resulting in
clearer code.

Change-Id: I4c675bac5f6cadff018e5d7d2f689d21b3e504ce

commit_message:
Improve startup performance of nova-compute Hyper-V driver

During the nova-compute driver startup, a lot of calls are made to
get_windows_version slowing down startup.
This patch speeds up the startup by caching the windows version to
be used for later calls of get_windows_version.

Change-Id: I5b2eadc0bce79cd261a5dcaac7712c23c49dfcc2

commit_message:
Improve startup performance of nova-compute Hyper-V driver

During the nova-compute driver startup, a lot of calls are made to
get_windows_version slowing down startup.
This patch speeds up the startup by caching the windows version to
be used for later calls of get_windows_version.

Change-Id: Ie555088abe20c2c6dcb8340dd61745f710a0323e

commit_message:
Automatically generate neutron LBaaS configuration files

This adds a new tox environment, genconfig, which generates sample
neutron LBaaS configuration file using oslo-config-generator.

DocImpact: Update the docs that LBaaS no longer includes static example
configuration files. Instead, use tools/generate_config_file_samples.sh
to generate them and the files generated now end with .sample extension.

Partially-Implements: blueprint autogen-neutron-conf-file

Change-Id: I25507f3bc6e995580aa91a912c2cf4110757df15
Partial-bug: #1199963

commit_message:
Avoid to use common.cert_manager directly

Conductor has a utility to manage bay specific certificates.
This patch changes to use it.
And also this patch fixes temporary place holder classes related
to bp:objects-from-bay.

Change-Id: I55d7fe33d7a910b9ba76bcbb4c39353fe7fac2f4
Closes-Bug: #1523843

commit_message:
Fix neutron issue w/ l2pop

This change resolves an issue where neutron is not able to bind to
a given port because l2 population is disabled and no vxlan multicast
group has been defined. To resolve this the `neutron_l2_population`
variable is being defined and set to "False" in the os_neutron defaults
and the vxlan multicast group will now contain a default value instead
of an empty string.

The change also removes the neutron_l2_population checks in the tasks
and templates because the variable is now being defined.

Change-Id: Ic2973626d88781bfc67a4275afcf9feffeb63f36
Closes-Bug: #1521793
Co-Authored-by: Ville Vuorinen <ville.vuorinen@multim.fi>
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix mesos monitor for handling multiple masters

Magnum is going to enable HA mode for mesos bay, in which there
could be more than one master nodes. One of the master node (leader)
is active and the rest of them is not active. Mesos monitor needs to
identify the leader and pull metrics from the leader only.

Change-Id: Ic7d6cb64964db2758163bd231dec4190302155b2
Partial-Implements: blueprint mesos-multi-master-node

commit_message:
Rename analyzer/builder functions/methods

Some of the names are 'iter_*' and others are 'iterate_*'
so this just rename the 'iter_*' to be 'iterate_*' and also
hides a couple of analyzer methods that are not used
externally (and really don't need to be exposed).

Change-Id: Ibd5180a0cf2b40d914cd668137473d1fbab445cd
