', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-12-03 14:30:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add MockContextManager

It is used in murano-test-runner.

Mocks are inserted into new context, that is created
from the current context:
If mock for the current object exist, new linked context
   (``murano.dsl.linked_context.LinkedContext``) will be returned. It links
   existing context with the new context, where mock definition is presented.
   So if mocked function will be called, context will contain two
   definitions with that function: mock and original one, but mock will have
   higher priority.

If there is no mock for the current object or class, existing context
   will be returned. If there is no existing context, *None* will be returned.

Targets blueprint mock-context-manager

Depends-On: I9eccdf3af1802c731bfdfb93df92c4ad902a4d34

commit_message:
Add MockContextManager

It is used in murano-test-runner.

Mocks are inserted into new context, that is created
from the current context:
If mock for the current object exist, new linked context
   (``murano.dsl.linked_context.LinkedContext``) will be returned. It links
   existing context with the new context, where mock definition is presented.
   So if mocked function will be called, context will contain two
   definitions with that function: mock and original one, but mock will have
   higher priority.

If there is no mock for the current object or class, existing context
   will be returned. If there is no existing context, *None* will be returned.

Targets blueprint mock-context-manager

Depends-On: I9eccdf3af1802c731bfdfb93df92c4ad902a4d34
Change-Id: I9a55d07188ff06bdf98248f011a700c297e33417

subject: [WIP] Support new ironic "enroll" state
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-09 15:27:54.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/baremetal/fakes.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/baremetal/test_baremetal.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/baremetal.py', 'tripleoclient/exceptions.py'], 'message': '[WIP] Support new ironic "enroll" state

This state was introduced in Liberty as a new state for freshly
enrolled node. Transition from it is done by the same verb "manage",
but now involves validation of power credentials.

This commit also

 - adds an error_message parameter to utils.wait_for_provision_state and
   utils.set_nodes_state
 - makes utils.wait_for_provision_state raise appropriate exceptions on
   error rather than returning False
 - adds a utils.nodes_in_states function to list baremetal nodes in a
   given set of states.
 - adds logic to baremetal/fakes.py to track states of fake nodes; this
   is much simpler and less brittle than precisely mocking the results of
   API calls in exactly the order the library code makes them.
 - consistently mocks bulk introspection tests at the client layer,
   rather than at a variety of layers.
 - adds tests for timeout and power-credential error during bulk introspection.

Change-Id: Ic12b39ff3c162401510027844c46bd00d6c29642
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Support new ironic "enroll" state

This state was introduced in Liberty as a new state for freshly
enrolled node. Transition from it is done by the same verb "manage",
but now involves validation of power credentials.

This commit also

 - adds an error_message parameter to utils.wait_for_provision_state and
   utils.set_nodes_state
 - makes utils.wait_for_provision_state raise appropriate exceptions on
   error rather than returning False
 - adds a utils.nodes_in_states function to list baremetal nodes in a
   given set of states.
 - adds logic to baremetal/fakes.py to track states of fake nodes; this
   is much simpler and less brittle than precisely mocking the results of
   API calls in exactly the order the library code makes them.
 - consistently mocks bulk introspection tests at the client layer,
   rather than at a variety of layers.
 - adds tests for timeout and power-credential error during bulk introspection.

Change-Id: Ic12b39ff3c162401510027844c46bd00d6c29642

commit_message:
Fix 'offloading types' tests

Correct verification points where hardcoded 'eth'-like
names of interfaces were used.
Additionally update the way the interfaces data are
prepared for the tests, to avoid duplicating code.

Closes-bug: #1523419

subject: Fix reconnection when heartbeat is missed
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-04 14:11:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix reconnection when heartbeat is missed

When a heartbeat is missing we call ensure_connection()
that runs a dummy method to trigger the reconnection
code in kombu. But also the code is triggered only if the
channel is None.

In case of the heartbeat threads we didn't reset the channel
before reconnecting, so the dummy method doesn't do anything.

This change sets the channel to None to ensure the connection
is reestablished before the dummy method is run.

Also it replaces the dummy method by checking the kombu connection
object. So we are sure the connection is reestablished.

Change-Id: I39f8cd23c5a5498e6f4c1aa3236ed27f3b5d7c9a
Closes-bug: #1493890
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-09 06:45:36.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "Fix reconnection when heartbeat is missed

When a heartbeat is missing we call ensure_connection()
that runs a dummy method to trigger the reconnection
code in kombu. But also the code is triggered only if the
channel is None.

In case of the heartbeat threads we didn't reset the channel
before reconnecting, so the dummy method doesn't do anything.

This change sets the channel to None to ensure the connection
is reestablished before the dummy method is run.

Also it replaces the dummy method by checking the kombu connection
object. So we are sure the connection is reestablished.

Change-Id: I39f8cd23c5a5498e6f4c1aa3236ed27f3b5d7c9a
Closes-bug: #1493890
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix reconnection when heartbeat is missed

When a heartbeat is missing we call ensure_connection()
that runs a dummy method to trigger the reconnection
code in kombu. But also the code is triggered only if the
channel is None.

In case of the heartbeat threads we didn't reset the channel
before reconnecting, so the dummy method doesn't do anything.

This change sets the channel to None to ensure the connection
is reestablished before the dummy method is run.

Also it replaces the dummy method by checking the kombu connection
object. So we are sure the connection is reestablished.

Change-Id: I39f8cd23c5a5498e6f4c1aa3236ed27f3b5d7c9a
Closes-bug: #1493890

commit_message:
Rename efficiency to efficacy

Some Python class and packages need to be renamed
for a better compliance with the shared Terminology
which provides a better understanding of Watcher
objects and components by every contributor.

This patchset is there to change efficiency to efficacy

Partially implements: blueprint glossary-related-refactoring

Change-Id: I4c84192d49a147e0fd406da35e2805143b902331

commit_message:
Expose function signature fetching function

This function is the recommended way to get information
about functions going forward, so all the variations of
getargspec can just use this instead (including the variations
of this used in openstack).

This exposes a 'get_signature' function that correctly aliases
the exposed function in python3.x and the backwards compat
library (funcsigs) that exposes this same information in python2.x

Internally in the other reflection functions we now switch
away from using getargspec as well, and replace it with using
this new signature object/function instead.

Depends-On: I1aa0054089ca57fc2d68779f4ee133a9750fec2a

Change-Id: I910b353f5db290832ef87bf7c5e5bb2e9788e3ec

commit_message:
Add support for unaddressed port

This patch alters the 'port_security_enabled' schema in DB from boolean to a
tri-value string. It will only be one of ['True', 'False', 'L2ONLY']. 'True'
and 'False' are compatible with the boolean meaning before, and 'L2ONLY' is for
unaddressed port.
'L2ONLY' not only a flag for create a unaddressed-port from a network with
subnet, but also indicate the filter remove the L3 and arp spoofing rules when
the port without IP address.

DocImpact
APIImpact

Partially Implements: blueprint vm-without-l3-address
Change-Id: I42cbe6fb82ad719dd023abe6272a43e7bfd82b6d

Fix 400 error in compute examples

The functional tests use the DevStack cirros image instead of a
fedora image. Update the examples tests to do the same since
the fedora image is not available in the test environment.

commit_message:
Use dict comprehension

PEP-0274 introduced dict comprehensions to replace dict constructor
with a sqeuence of key-pairs[1], these are benefits:
  First, it makes the code look neater.
  Second, it gains a micro-optimization.

We dropped python 2.6 support, we can leverage this now.
Note: This commit doesn't handle dict constructor with kwargs.

[1]http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0274/

Change-Id: I25d9d66f41e55dabdee2accca8a3f74160cc76b4

commit_message:
Declare RANDFILE explicitly

Point to openssl where RANDFILE is to avoid cases when this file
needed but not declared.

Change-Id: I19620d9f31eadfb345812de81d50b0326067c143
Closes-Bug: #1523449

commit_message:
Switch to new Ubuntu bootstrap image build script

 * Remove specific config-file for old script
 * Make Ubuntu default bootstrap OS
 * Add default repos for Ubuntu-based bootstrap

commit_message:
Trival: Remove 'MANIFEST.in'

Everything in this file is automatically generated by pbr. There
appears to be no good reason to keep it around.
More details please see:
https://github.com/openstack-dev/pbr/blob/master/pbr/packaging.py#L384

Change-Id: I4fb90bc0a2a18f0edd7012a76c961d6960205623

commit_message:
Publish the Python OpenStack SDK docs

Publish the Python OpenStack SDK docs to
developer.openstack.org/sdks/python/openstacksdk

This needs a separate publish job for the publishing part.

Note: building is done with the usual docs job-template which is already enabled
via the python-jobs templates.

Closes-Bug: #1479977

commit_message:
Replace if with method to get iface

I replaced if with a method which has logic
related to interface names.
Name is fetched by old naming schema to ease developer switch.

There is still a problem with yaml templates, should be fixed
in next commits.

Change-Id: I63787e51f9e74532f5dd49fb765cbe204b148eb1
Related-bug: #1523541

commit_message:
Add an option to filter packages by 'id' in API

This patch enhances the GET /catalog/packages Murano API call with
option to filter packages by id.

Partially implements bp assign-category-button

commit_message:
Handle deprecated opts' group correctly

Config generator is changed to use the option's group instead of just
'DEFAULT' if deprecated_group is not specified but deprecated_name is.

Change-Id: Icdf00ed70dd6133cb76d31f6f26a8f3d9a3874b4
Closes-bug: #1523958

subject: Handle None section name in MultiOptConfigParser#get
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-04 11:20:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Handle None section name in MultiOptConfigParser#get

A lot of oslo.config accepts None to mean the 'DEFAULT' section, but
MultiOptConfigParser#get doesn't. Establish this as an invariant on
MultiOptConfigParser.

Note _check_deprecated already did this but I've removed the logic here
as it's only called by _get (and tests) which now handles the job for
it. I had to fix a couple of tests because of this, this should be OK
because _check_deprecated is a private method so we don't guarantee API
stability.

Change-Id: I1a983df12ca550cd22d8edb806c3acc71313a959
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-04 11:48:24.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/tests/test_cfg.py', 'oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Handle None section name in MultiOptConfigParser#get

MultiOptConfigParser#get doesn't. Establish this as an invariant on
MultiOptConfigParser.

Note _check_deprecated already did this but I've removed the logic here
as it's only called by _get (and tests) which now handles the job for
it. This means one of the tests was redundant so I've removed it.
Altering _check_deprecated should be OK because it's a private method so
we don't guarantee API stability.

Change-Id: I1a983df12ca550cd22d8edb806c3acc71313a959
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Handle None section name in MultiOptConfigParser#get

A lot of oslo.config accepts None to mean the 'DEFAULT' section, but
MultiOptConfigParser#get doesn't. Establish this as an invariant on
MultiOptConfigParser.

Note _check_deprecated already did this but I've removed the logic here
as it's only called by _get (and tests) which now handles the job for
it. This means one of the tests was redundant so I've removed it.
Altering _check_deprecated should be OK because it's a private method so
we don't guarantee API stability.

Change-Id: I1a983df12ca550cd22d8edb806c3acc71313a959

$qemu-img info sheepdog:volume-1af1afa0-7820-4063-9b90-4fa6161a74a9

commit_message:
Fix the bug of can't get the desired image info

When we use 'qemu-img info' command to get image info, some kinds
of image may show an 'unavailable' disk size. For example:

$qemu-img info sheepdog:volume-1af1afa0-7820-4063-9b90-4fa6161a74a9
image: sheepdog:volume-1af1afa0-7820-4063-9b90-4fa6161a74a9
file format: raw
virtual size: 10G (10737418240 bytes)
disk size: unavailable

$qemu-img info -f rbd rbd:data/foo
image: rbd:data/foo
file format: rbd
virtual size: 10G (10737418240 bytes)
disk size: unavailable
cluster_size: 4194304

The current code didn't consider 'unavailable' size, and it will
raise a ValueError in this case. This patch fixed this bug by
adding the judgment of 'unavailable' size.

I also fixed some problems of the test case.
(This patch is a sync from cinder:
Change-Id Ic5f3b80e172baaafc07432319f8aa24bf117b392)

Change-Id: Ie64822299af5ca20f9e1961cfab386c38729444d
Closes-Bug: #1516083

commit_message:
Fix internal Neutron network name for Sahara templates

Default name for internal Neutron network was changed to 'admin_internal_net',
hence we need also update default for Sahara templates.

Change-Id: I4bcd8156494859a57e207ccedb0e9e562f8e5974
Closes-bug: #1520574

subject: Allow setting manage_service and enable again on storage services
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-09 14:49:06.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/storage/all.pp', 'manifests/storage/server.pp'], 'message': 'Allow setting manage_service and enable again on storage services

Patch I2f71c82c7a6c463f8c76a193409c0a17daa15bda changed
storage/server.pp to use resource-like definitions instead of includes
on swift::storage::${type} classes. This prevents creating
swift::storage::* class the resource-like way outside of
swift::storage::server by leading to duplicate declaration error,
breaking TripleO HA deployments. We need to preserve at least the way to
control $manage_service and $enable for the storage services.

Change-Id: Ia91bac4eaf78b4fbf80947bab1c7b3a8433b68a0
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow setting manage_service and enable again on storage services

Patch I2f71c82c7a6c463f8c76a193409c0a17daa15bda changed
storage/server.pp to use resource-like definitions instead of includes
on swift::storage::${type} classes. This prevents creating
swift::storage::* class the resource-like way outside of
swift::storage::server by leading to duplicate declaration error,
breaking TripleO HA deployments. We need to preserve at least the way to
control $manage_service and $enable for the storage services.

Change-Id: Ia91bac4eaf78b4fbf80947bab1c7b3a8433b68a0

commit_message:
oslo.messaging option group/name change for notification topics

In Ib51e2839f9035d0cc0e3f459939d9f9003a8c810, oslo.messaging
is introducing a new group for the notifiction options. This
review is the minimum needed to support both old and
newer oslo.messaging versions. (In other words, next
oslo.messaging release will break ceilometer unless we
work around for the new option group)

Change-Id: I4765b3b9627983a245aa5521a85ad89e83ab8551

* Add customized support net.ifnames

', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-12-08 15:49:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Workaround to let rename udev interface using as PXE on Ubuntu bootstrap

 The interface used for PXE booting is eth0 interface (because it's up first).
 Since Ubuntu uses Upstart-udev-bridge to communicate to udev the udev events
 (renaming interfaces) are processed quite late, when eth0 interface is in UP
 state and /etc/network/interfaces (config file) has been created.
 When udev attempts to rename the eth0 interface it gets "device busy" message.
 To let the eth0 interface be renamed the following steps are used in
 the /usr/bin/let-rename script:

1. Scan the interfaces to figure out which one in active (UP) state and has not
   been renamed, because we have just one PXE interface, we are looking for it.
2. The interface state is changed to DOWN (release DHCP leases) by the command
   ifdown $intf
3. The current interface name ($oldname) and MAC address of the interface are
   recalled.
4. The udev event (for subsystem net, action add) is issued, which forces
   renaming of the eth0 to a new name by the commands:
   udevadm trigger --subsystem-match=net --action=add
   udevadm settle
5. At that point interface's (eth0) name has been changed and we are looking
   for interface which MAC address is equal to the remembered MAC address of
   eth0. New name is the renamed eth0 is saved in $newname variable.
6. Update /etc/network/interfaces (config file) by substituting $oldname of
   the interface to the $newname by the command
   sed -i -e "s/$oldname/$newname/g" /etc/network/interfaces
7. Enabling the interface by the command
   ifup $newname

Change-Id: I80d65ba597f4b6361d67a629c4627739afd37116
Implements: blueprint network-interfaces-naming-schema
', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-12-08 16:03:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Workaround to let rename udev interface using as PXE on Ubuntu bootstrap

 The interface used for PXE booting is eth0 interface (because it's up first).
 Since Ubuntu uses Upstart-udev-bridge to communicate to udev the udev events
 (renaming interfaces) are processed quite late, when eth0 interface is in UP
 state and /etc/network/interfaces (config file) has been created.
 When udev attempts to rename the eth0 interface it gets "device busy" message.
 To let the eth0 interface be renamed the following steps are used in
 the /usr/bin/let-rename script:

1. Scan the interfaces to figure out which one in active (UP) state and has not
   been renamed, because we have just one PXE interface, we are looking for it.
2. The interface state is changed to DOWN (release DHCP leases) by the command
   ifdown $intf
3. The current interface name ($oldname) and MAC address of the interface are
   recalled.
4. The udev event (for subsystem net, action add) is issued, which forces
   renaming of the eth0 to a new name by the commands:
   udevadm trigger --subsystem-match=net --action=add
   udevadm settle
5. At that point interface's (eth0) name has been changed and we are looking
   for interface which MAC address is equal to the remembered MAC address of
   eth0. New name is the renamed eth0 is saved in $newname variable.
6. Update /etc/network/interfaces (config file) by substituting $oldname of
   the interface to the $newname by the command
   sed -i -e "s/$oldname/$newname/g" /etc/network/interfaces
7. Enabling the interface by the command
   ifup $newname

Change-Id: I80d65ba597f4b6361d67a629c4627739afd37116
Implements: blueprint network-interfaces-naming-schema
', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-12-08 16:12:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Workaround to let rename udev interface using as PXE on Ubuntu bootstrap

 The interface is used for PXE booting is eth0 interface (because it becomes up the very first).
 Since Ubuntu uses Upstart-udev-bridge to communicate to udev the udev events (renaming interfaces) are processed quite later, when the eth0 interface is in the UP state and /etc/network/interfaces (config file) has been created.
 When udev attempts to rename the eth0 interface it receives "device busy" message (because eth0 is in UP state).
 To let the eth0 interface be renamed the following steps are used in
 the /usr/bin/let-rename script:

1. Scan the interfaces to figure out which one is in the active (UP) state and has not been renamed. Because we have just one PXE interface, we are looking for that interface (all other in down state).
2. The state of found interface is changed to DOWN (release DHCP leases) by the command:
   ifdown $intf
3. The current interface name ($oldname) and MAC address ($macaddr) of the interface are saved and will be handy later.
4. The udev event (for subsystem net, action add) is issued, which forces renaming of the eth0 to a new name by the commands:
   udevadm trigger --subsystem-match=net --action=add
   udevadm settle
5. At that point interface's name (eth0) has been changed and we are looking for interface which MAC address is equal to the remembered MAC address of the former eth0. Found new name (of the renamed eth0 interface) is saved in the $newname variable.
6. Update /etc/network/interfaces (config file) by substituting all $oldname of the interface to the $newname by the command:
   sed -i -e "s/$oldname/$newname/g" /etc/network/interfaces
7. Enabling the renamed interface by the command
   ifup $newname

Change-Id: I80d65ba597f4b6361d67a629c4627739afd37116

2. The state of found interface is changed to DOWN (release DHCP leases) by the

3. The current interface name ($oldname) and MAC address ($macaddr) of the

4. The udev event (for subsystem net, action add) is issued, which forces

5. At that point interface's name (eth0) has been changed and we are looking

commit_message:
Workaround to let rename udev interface using as PXE on Ubuntu bootstrap

 Passing kernel parameters biosdevname=0 and net.ifnames=1 enable
 persistant interface naming schema and disable 75-persistent-net-generator.rules

 The interface is used for PXE booting is eth0 interface (because it becomes up
  the very first).
 Since Ubuntu uses Upstart-udev-bridge to communicate to udev the udev events
  (renaming interfaces) are processed quite later, when the eth0 interface is
  in the UP state and /etc/network/interfaces (config file) has been created.
 When udev attempts to rename the eth0 interface it receives "device busy"
  message (because eth0 is in UP state).
 To let the eth0 interface be renamed the following steps are used in
 the /usr/bin/let-rename script:

1. Scan the interfaces to figure out which one is in the active (UP) state and
   has not been renamed. Because we have just one PXE interface, we are looking
   for that interface (all others in the down state).
2. The state of the found interface is changed to DOWN (release DHCP leases) by the
   command:
    ifdown $intf
3. The current interface name ($oldname) and MAC address ($macaddr) of the
   interface are saved and will be handy later.
4. The udev event (for subsystem net, action add) is issued, which forces
   renaming of the eth0 to a new name by the commands:
    udevadm trigger --subsystem-match=net --action=add
    udevadm settle
5. At that point interface's name (eth0) has been changed and we are looking
   for interface which MAC address is equal to the remembered MAC address of
   the former eth0. Found new name (of the renamed eth0 interface) is saved in
   the $newname variable.
6. Update /etc/network/interfaces (config file) by substituting all $oldname
   of the interface to the $newname by the command:
    sed -i -e "s/$oldname/$newname/g" /etc/network/interfaces
7. Enabling the renamed interface by the command
   ifup $newname

Change-Id: I80d65ba597f4b6361d67a629c4627739afd37116
Implements: blueprint network-interfaces-naming-schema
Closes-Bug: #1524303

commit_message:
Disable ceilometer services in devstack compute template

In the local.conf.compute template disable the ceilometer control
services that are enabled by default by the ceilometer plugin

Change-Id: Iaaeebaf99fdfbfbc4fdeb191652c1587d7eae8e9

[WIP] CentOS 7 Support

* remove custom ruby and use upstream one
* adjust packages names
* unnail packages versions
* add if-clause for backward compatibility

commit_message:
Enable SSL for clouds in system tests

SSL is going to be disabled by default for new
OpenStack environments, so tests must enable it
if 'DISABLE_SSL' is not set to 'True'.

Related-bug: #1520495
Change-Id: Ib3a851413c935e1423910fd65ea4f3086a5cd17d

From rsyslogd documentation:

  fromhost
    hostname of the system the message was received from
    (in a relay chain, this is the system immediately in
    front of us and not necessarily the original sender).
    This is a DNS-resolved name, except if that is not
    possible or DNS resolution has been disabled.

So it might be either hostname or IP address, however,
regex filter will work for IP address only.

Change-Id: I46e00f0273671a92126ce29a5bcebac257bedf03

commit_message:
Use IP based regex for rsyslog

From rsyslogd documentation:

  fromhost
    hostname of the system the message was received from
    (in a relay chain, this is the system immediately in
    front of us and not necessarily the original sender).
    This is a DNS-resolved name, except if that is not
    possible or DNS resolution has been disabled.

So it might be either hostname or IP address, however,
regex filter will work for IP address only.

This commit forces IP usage of IP addresses only.

Closes-Bug: #1523488

Change-Id: I46e00f0273671a92126ce29a5bcebac257bedf03

User password update hardcoded the endpoint_filter to always use the public
endpoint. This will break deployments where services behind the firewall have
no access to the public endpoint. Endpoint selection should be allowed
by the end user (i.e. openstack --os-interface internal user password set).

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove hardcoded endpoint filter for update password

User password update hardcoded the endpoint_filter to always use the public
endpoint. This will break deployments where services behind the firewall have
no access to the public endpoint. Endpoint selection should be allowed
by the end user (i.e. openstack --os-interface internal user password set).

Closes-Bug: 1503459

Change-Id: Ib11d60cd8e81b99aedb27f1cbbf6b79218045cf0
(cherry picked from commit d47da3b59c581dd3bb6bd4d75de819d0fd734fa5)

commit_message:
Notify about port create/update unconditionally

The notification about port create/update should be done no matter
if host (or any other field) was changed or not - it should be up to
handler to decide how to handle it.

This also fixes the bug when there was actually no notification to l3
dvr agent on compute node on new port creation:
_get_host_port_if_changed() always returned None - this is a regression
from commit 2ee08c3464c53abaf9bc5493132ad7958611e3b8

Closes-Bug: #1521524

commit_message:
Add twemproxy as default proxy for memcache

All openstack services will use twemproxy instead of use
memcached directly.

Change-Id: I469ba4456d550bdc1dacb1eb3634daa94b121883

commit_message:
loop cleanup

this patch just cleans up some nested loops to use itertools.product
and ensures a loop isn't run twice unless needed.

Change-Id: I0864dcf73bd4cbcbf957187b2601998def0f7cfc

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-30 11:18:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Avoid intermediate Token auth plugin

Basic issue, we fetch a token from the admin auth plugin
and use that to create a Token auth plugin. Problem is that
the Token auth plugin does not know how to re-authenticate
when tokens are lost (say memcached backend is rebooted).
The Token auth plugin fails to get a new token from keystone
and subsequently operations fail.

There were several attempts to fix this problem, please see:
Ib9805ec6184fb623d4c6b2fa68a0cc0f5c90ccb8
Ic721fa94d56d5e11b004b493dbe9fa15176f43e3
I7c20fb0cb623236b977343f24db10d95db45b7ae

And finally the consensus was that we should use the auth
plugin first loaded directly and avoid creating the
intermediate auth Token plugin. One problem with this was that
as there was no lock around re-authentication, there was a chance
that many fresh tokens may be minted. A fix was made in
python-keystoneclient to reduce the chance of this
happening as well. please see:
Ib6487de7de638abc69660c851bd048a8ec177109

Change-Id: I237046bc023f13bd187f7dc795e4365ae020e6e9
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-30 13:53:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Avoid intermediate Token auth plugin

And finally the consensus was that we should use the auth
plugin first loaded directly and avoid creating the
intermediate auth Token plugin. One problem with this was that
as there was no lock around re-authentication, there was a chance
that many fresh tokens may be minted. A fix was made in
python-keystoneclient to reduce the chance of this
happening as well. please see:

commit_message:
Avoid intermediate Token auth plugin

Basic issue, we fetch a token from the admin auth plugin
and use that to create a Token auth plugin. Problem is that
the Token auth plugin does not know how to re-authenticate
when tokens are lost (say memcached backend is rebooted).
The Token auth plugin fails to get a new token from keystone
and subsequently operations fail.

There were several attempts to fix this problem, please see:
Ib9805ec6184fb623d4c6b2fa68a0cc0f5c90ccb8
Ic721fa94d56d5e11b004b493dbe9fa15176f43e3
I7c20fb0cb623236b977343f24db10d95db45b7ae

And finally the consensus was that we should use the auth
plugin first loaded directly and avoid creating the
intermediate auth Token plugin. One problem with this was that
as there was no lock around re-authentication, there was a chance
that many fresh tokens may be minted. A fix was made in
python-keystoneclient to reduce the chance of this
happening as well. please see:
Ib6487de7de638abc69660c851bd048a8ec177109

Change-Id: I237046bc023f13bd187f7dc795e4365ae020e6e9

commit_message:
Replace N block_device_mapping queries with 1

The ExtendedVolumes post-processing extension used to do N
block_device_mapping queries (one query per instance in a 'nova list').
Instead, do one block_device_mapping query with an IN clause of
instance UUIDs.

Partial-Bug: #1416132
Closes-Bug: #1359808

Change-Id: I32a1bd0e05a7a938e531d00bedfab23a0bb68538
(cherry picked from commit 110bb30d0f2a183aa54ec1289a58a15ea26b0495)

commit_message:
DVR:don't reschedule the l3 agent running on compute node

For a DVR router, when it updates router gateway_ip, it should not
reschedule the l3 agents running on compute nodes whose mode is dvr,
it just need to reschedule the l3 agents running on network nodes
whose mode is dvr_snat.

Closes-bug: #1496204

Conflicts:

	neutron/tests/unit/db/test_agentschedulers_db.py

Change-Id: Ib8ea6797c88cefb473eff9a8a7b2517a6aa90ca4
(cherry picked from commit 13ce7c85552ee6af9856bf701b55d2293ba5610d)

commit_message:
[StreamingAlgorithms] Unify exception type raised by result()

Method result() of some streaming algorithms raises RallyException,
while other raise ValueError. This is strange because we have
common case so there should be only one exception type.

This patch unifies exception type to RallyException

Change-Id: Ic24c851a05de024e56f0149aa82a6e74b96d64a6

[{'created': '2015-12-03 09:55:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ensure l3 agent receives notification about added router

Currently router_added (and other) notifications are sent
to agents with an RPC cast() method which does not ensure that
the message is actually delivered to the recipient.
If the message is lost (due to instability of messaging system
in some failover scenarios for example) neither server nor agent
will be aware of that and router will be "lost" till next agent
resync. Resync will only happen in case of errors on agent side
or restart.
The fix makes server use call() to notify agents about added routers
thus ensuring no routers will be lost.
This also unifies reschedule_router() method to avoid code duplication
between legacy and dvr agent schedulers.

Closes-Bug: #1482630
Related-Bug #1404743
Change-Id: Id08764ba837d8f47a28649d081a5876797fe369e
(cherry picked from commit 30b121dfa4d8542665b2209d21ece805d8957aa5)

commit_message:
Ensure l3 agent receives notification about added router

Currently router_added (and other) notifications are sent
to agents with an RPC cast() method which does not ensure that
the message is actually delivered to the recipient.
If the message is lost (due to instability of messaging system
in some failover scenarios for example) neither server nor agent
will be aware of that and router will be "lost" till next agent
resync. Resync will only happen in case of errors on agent side
or restart.
The fix makes server use call() to notify agents about added routers
thus ensuring no routers will be lost.
This also unifies reschedule_router() method to avoid code duplication
between legacy and dvr agent schedulers.

Closes-Bug: #1482630
Related-Bug #1404743
Change-Id: Id08764ba837d8f47a28649d081a5876797fe369e
(cherry picked from commit 30b121dfa4d8542665b2209d21ece805d8957aa5)

commit_message:
Update OpenstackConfig.find_configs to return query object

OpenstackConfig.find_configs should return query, not list
since NalgunCollection.to_json expects iterable object and
has incorrect behaviour when trying to pass empty list
as an iterable parameter.

Closes-Bug: #1523477
Change-Id: I50aaaa9a20dbf55d83a418189f808cd3829a8002
